intro: Macrocarpaea zophoflora, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences, and the species is noted for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
